command.name: help
command.help: Provides help information about console commands.

command.name: asset
command.help: Allows you to combine and compress your JavaScript and CSS files.

command.name: asset/compress
command.help: (default): Combines and compresses the asset files according to the given configuration.

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

option.name: --color
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1
whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

option.name: --interactive
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
whether to run the command interactively.

command.name: asset/template
command.help: Creates template of configuration file for [[actionCompress]].

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

option.name: --color
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1
whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

option.name: --interactive
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
whether to run the command interactively.

command.name: cache
command.help: Allows you to flush cache. Lists the caches that can be flushed.

command.name: cache/flush
command.help: Flushes given cache components.

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

option.name: --color
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1
whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

option.name: --interactive
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
whether to run the command interactively.

command.name: cache/flush-all
command.help: Flushes all caches registered in the system.

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

option.name: --color
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1
whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

option.name: --interactive
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
whether to run the command interactively.

command.name: cache/flush-schema
command.help: Clears DB schema cache for a given connection component.

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

option.name: --color
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1
whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

option.name: --interactive
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
whether to run the command interactively.

command.name: fixture
command.help:
Manages fixture data loading and unloading.

load fixtures from UsersFixture class with default namespace "tests\unit\fixtures"
yii fixture/load User
also a short version of this command (generate action is default)
yii fixture User
load all fixtures
yii fixture "*"
load all fixtures except User
yii fixture "*" -User
load fixtures with different namespace.
yii fixture/load User --namespace=alias\my\custom\namespace\goes\here

The unload sub-command can be used similarly to unload fixtures.

command.name: fixture/load
command.help:
(default): Loads the specified fixture data.
load the fixture data specified by User and UserProfile.
any existing fixture data will be removed first
yii fixture/load User UserProfile
load all available fixtures found under 'tests\unit\fixtures'
yii fixture/load "*"
load all fixtures except User and UserProfile
yii fixture/load "*" -User -UserProfile

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

option.name: --color
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1
whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

option.name: --globalFixtures
option.help:
array
global fixtures that should be applied when loading and unloading.
By default it is set to `InitDbFixture` that disables and enables integrity check,
so your data can be safely loaded.

option.name: --interactive
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
whether to run the command interactively.

option.name: --namespace
option.help:
string (defaults to 'tests\unit\fixtures')
default namespace to search fixtures in

command.name: fixture/unload
command.help:
Unloads the specified fixtures.

unload the fixture data specified by User and UserProfile.
yii fixture/unload User UserProfile
unload all fixtures found under 'tests\unit\fixtures'
yii fixture/unload "*"
unload all fixtures except User and UserProfile
yii fixture/unload "*" -User -UserProfile

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

option.name: --color
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1
whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

option.name: --globalFixtures
option.help:
array
global fixtures that should be applied when loading and unloading.
By default it is set to `InitDbFixture` that disables and enables integrity check,
so your data can be safely loaded.

option.name: --interactive
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
whether to run the command interactively.

option.name: --namespace
option.help:
string (defaults to 'tests\unit\fixtures')
default namespace to search fixtures in

command.name: gii
command.help:
This is the command line version of Gii - a code generator.
You can use this command to generate models, controllers, etc. For example,
to generate an ActiveRecord model based on a DB table, you can run:
yii gii/model --tableName=city --modelClass=City

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

option.name: --color
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1
whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

option.name: --interactive
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
whether to run the command interactively.

option.name: --overwrite
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 0)
whether to overwrite all existing code files when in non-interactive mode.
Defaults to false, meaning none of the existing code files will be overwritten.
This option is used only when `--interactive=0`.

command.name: gii/controller
command.help:
This generator helps you to quickly generate a new controller class with
one or several controller actions and their corresponding views.

option.name: --actions
option.help:
string (defaults to 'index')
Provide one or multiple action IDs to generate empty action method(s) in the controller.
Separate multiple action IDs with commas or spaces. Action IDs should be in lower case.
For example:
  • index generatesactionIndex()
  • create-order generates actionCreateOrder()

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

option.name: --baseClass
option.help:
string (defaults to 'yii\web\Controller')
This is the class that the new controller class will extend from. Please make sure the
class exists and can be autoloaded

option.name: --color
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1
whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

option.name: --controllerClass
option.help:
(required): string
This is the name of the controller class to be generated. You should
provide a fully qualified namespaced class (e.g. app\controllers\PostController),
and class name should be in CamelCase ending with the word Controller.
Make sure the class is using the same namespace as specified by your application's
controllerNamespace property.
that support it.

option.name: --enableI18N
option.help: boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 0)

option.name: --interactive
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
whether to run the command interactively.

option.name: --messageCategory
option.help: string (defaults to 'app')

option.name: --overwrite
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 0)
whether to overwrite all existing code files when in non-interactive mode.
Defaults to false, meaning none of the existing code files will be overwritten.
This option is used only when `--interactive=0`.

option.name: --template
option.help: string (defaults to 'default')

option.name: --viewPath
option.help:
string
Specify the directory for storing the view scripts for the controller. You
may use path alias here, e.g., /var/www/basic/controllers/views/order,
@app/views/order. If not set, it will default to @app/views/ControllerID

command.name: gii/crud
command.help:
This generator generates a controller and views that implement CRUD
(Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations for the specified data model.

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

option.name: --baseControllerClass
option.help:
string (defaults to 'yii\web\Controller')
This is the class that the new CRUD controller class will extend from.
You should provide a fully qualified class name, e.g., yii\web\Controller.

option.name: --color
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1
whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

option.name: --controllerClass
option.help:
(required): string
This is the name of the controller class to be generated. You should
provide a fully qualified namespaced class (e.g. app\controllers\PostController),
and class name should be in CamelCase ending with the word Controller.
Make sure the class is using the same namespace as specified by your application's
controllerNamespace property.

option.name: --enableI18N
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 0)
This indicates whether the generator should generate strings using Yii::t() method.
Set this to true if you are planning to make your application translatable.

option.name: --indexWidgetType
option.help:
string (defaults to 'grid'
This is the widget type to be used in the index page to display list of the models.
You may choose either GridView or ListView

option.name: --interactive
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
whether to run the command interactively.

option.name: --messageCategory
option.help:
string (defaults to 'app')
This is the category used by Yii::t() in case you enable I18N.

option.name: --modelClass
option.help:
(required): string
This is the ActiveRecord class associated with the table that CRUD will be built upon.
You should provide a fully qualified class name, e.g., app\models\Post.

option.name: --overwrite
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 0)
whether to overwrite all existing code files when in non-interactive mode.
Defaults to false, meaning none of the existing code files will be overwritten.
This option is used only when `--interactive=0`.

option.name: --searchModelClass
option.help:
string (defaults to '')
This is the name of the search model class to be generated.
You should provide a fully qualified namespaced class name, e.g., app\models\PostSearch.

option.name: --template
option.help: string (defaults to 'default')

option.name: --viewPath
option.help:
string
Specify the directory for storing the view scripts for the controller. You
may use path alias here, e.g., /var/www/basic/controllers/views/order,
@app/views/order. If not set, it will default to @app/views/ControllerID

command.name: gii/extension
command.help: This generator helps you to generate the files needed by a Yii extension.

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

option.name: --authorEmail
option.help: (required): string

option.name: --authorName
option.help: (required): string

option.name: --color
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1
whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

option.name: --description
option.help:
(required): string
A sentence or subline describing the main purpose of the extension.

option.name: --enableI18N
option.help: boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 0)

option.name: --interactive
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
whether to run the command interactively.

option.name: --keywords
option.help:
string (defaults to 'yii2,extension')
Comma separated keywords for this extension.

option.name: --license
option.help: (required): string

option.name: --messageCategory
option.help: string (defaults to 'app')

option.name: --namespace
option.help:
(required): string
PSR-4, eg. myself\foobar\ This will be added to your autoloading by composer.
Do not use yii, yii2 or yiisoft in the namespace.

option.name: --outputPath
option.help:
string (defaults to '@app/runtime/tmp-extensions')
The temporary location of the generated files.

option.name: --overwrite
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 0)
whether to overwrite all existing code files when in non-interactive mode.
Defaults to false, meaning none of the existing code files will be overwritten.
This option is used only when `--interactive=0`.

option.name: --packageName
option.help:
string (defaults to 'yii2-')
This is the name of the extension on packagist, eg. yii2-foobar.

option.name: --template
option.help: string (defaults to 'default')

option.name: --title
option.help:
(required): string
A more descriptive name of your application for the README file.

option.name: --type
option.help: string (defaults to 'yii2-extension')

option.name: --vendorName
option.help:
(required): string
This refers to the name of the publisher, your GitHub user name is usually a good choice,
eg. myself.

command.name: gii/model
command.help: This generator generates an ActiveRecord class for the specified database table.

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

option.name: --baseClass
option.help:
string (defaults to 'yii\db\ActiveRecord')
This is the base class of the new ActiveRecord class. It should be a fully qualified namespaced class name.

option.name: --color
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1
whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

option.name: --db
option.help:
string (defaults to 'db')
This is the ID of the DB application component.

option.name: --enableI18N
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 0)
This indicates whether the generator should generate strings using Yii::t() method.
Set this to true if you are planning to make your application translatable.

option.name: --interactive
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
whether to run the command interactively.

option.name: --generateLabelsFromComments
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 0)
This indicates whether the generator should generate attribute labels by using the comments of the corresponding DB columns.

option.name: --generateRelations
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
This indicates whether the generator should generate relations based on foreign key constraints it detects in the database.
Note that if your database contains too many tables, you may want to uncheck this option to accelerate the code generation process.

option.name: --messageCategory
option.help:
string (defaults to 'app')
This is the category used by Yii::t() in case you enable I18N.

option.name: --modelClass
option.help:
(required): string
This is the name of the ActiveRecord class to be generated. The class name should not contain the namespace part as it is specified in "Namespace".
You do not need to specify the class name if "Table Name" ends with asterisk, in which case multiple ActiveRecord classes will be generated.

option.name: --ns
option.help:
string (defaults to 'app\models')
This is the namespace of the ActiveRecord class to be generated, e.g., app\models

option.name: --overwrite
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 0)
whether to overwrite all existing code files when in non-interactive mode.
Defaults to false, meaning none of the existing code files will be overwritten.
This option is used only when `--interactive=0`.

option.name: --tableName
option.help:
(required): string
This is the name of the DB table that the new ActiveRecord class is associated with, e.g. post. The table name may consist of the DB schema part if needed, e.g. public.post.
The table name may end with asterisk to match multiple table names, e.g. tbl_* will match tables who name starts with tbl_. In this case, multiple ActiveRecord classes will be generated, one for each matching table name; and the class names will be generated from the matching characters.
For example, table tbl_post will generate Post class.

option.name: --template
option.help: string (defaults to 'default')

option.name: --useTablePrefix
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 0)
This indicates whether the table name returned by the generated ActiveRecord class should consider the tablePrefix setting of the DB connection.
For example, if the table name is tbl_post and tablePrefix=tbl_, the ActiveRecord class will return the table name as {{%post}}.

command.name: gii/module
command.help: This generator helps you to generate the skeleton code needed by a Yii module.

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

option.name: --color
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1
whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

option.name: --enableI18N
option.help: boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 0)

option.name: --interactive
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
whether to run the command interactively.

option.name: --messageCategory
option.help: string (defaults to 'app')

option.name: --moduleClass
option.help:
(required): string
This is the fully qualified class name of the module, e.g., app\modules\admin\Module.

option.name: --moduleID
option.help:
(required): string
This refers to the ID of the module, e.g., admin.

option.name: --overwrite
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 0)
whether to overwrite all existing code files when in non-interactive mode.
Defaults to false, meaning none of the existing code files will be overwritten.
This option is used only when `--interactive=0`.

option.name: --template
option.help: string (defaults to 'default')

command.name: message
command.help:
Extracts messages to be translated from source files.

The extracted messages can be saved the following depending on format setting in config file:
- PHP message source files.
- ".po" files.
- Database.

Usage:
1. Create a configuration file using the 'message/config' command:
yii message/config /path/to/myapp/messages/config.php
2. Edit the created config file, adjusting it for your web application needs.
3. Run the 'message/extract' command, using created config:
yii message /path/to/myapp/messages/config.php

command.name: message/config
command.help:
Creates a configuration file for the "extract" command.

The generated configuration file contains detailed instructions on how to customize it to fit for your needs.
After customization, you may use this configuration file with the "extract" command.
- file-path (required): string output file name or alias.

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

option.name: --color
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1
whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

option.name: --interactive
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
whether to run the command interactively.

command.name: message/extract
command.help:
Extracts messages to be translated from source code.

This command will search through source code files and extract messages that need to be translated in different languages.

- config-file (required): string the path or alias of the configuration file.
You may use the "yii message/config" command to generate this file and then customize it for your needs.

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

option.name: --color
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1
whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

option.name: --interactive
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
whether to run the command interactively.

command.name: migrate
command.help:
Manages application migrations.

A migration means a set of persistent changes to the application environment that is shared among different developers. For example, in an application backed by a database, a migration may refer to a set of changes to the database, such as creating a new table, adding a new table column.

This command provides support for tracking the migration history, upgrading or downloading with migrations, and creating new migration skeletons.
The migration history is stored in a database table named as [[migrationTable]]. The table will be automatically created the first time this command is executed, if it does not exist. You may also manually create it as follows:
CREATE TABLE migration ( version varchar(180) PRIMARY KEY, apply_time integer )
Below are some common usages of this command:
creates a new migration named 'create_user_table'
yii migrate/create create_user_table
applies ALL new migrations
yii migrate
reverts the last applied migration
yii migrate/down

command.name: migrate/create
command.help:
Creates a new migration.

This command creates a new migration using the available migration template.
After using this command, developers should modify the created migration skeleton by filling up the actual migration logic.
yii migrate/create create_user_table

name (required): string
the name of the new migration. This should only contain letters, digits and/or underscores.

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

option.name: --color
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1
whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

option.name: --db
option.help:
Connection|array|string (defaults to 'db')
the DB connection object or the application component ID of the DB connection to use when applying migrations. Starting from version 2.0.3, this can also be a configuration array for creating the object.

option.name: --interactive
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
whether to run the command interactively.

option.name: --migrationPath
option.help:
string (defaults to '@app/migrations')
the directory storing the migration classes. This can be either a path alias or a directory.

option.name: --migrationTable
option.help:
string (defaults to '{{%migration}}')
the name of the table for keeping applied migration information.

option.name: --templateFile
option.help: defaults to '@yii/views/migration.php'

command.name: migrate/down
command.help:
Downgrades the application by reverting old migrations.

For example,
yii migrate/down # revert the last migration
yii migrate/down 3 # revert the last 3 migrations
yii migrate/down all # revert all migrations


- limit: integer (defaults to 1)
the number of migrations to be reverted. Defaults to 1, meaning the last applied migration will be reverted.

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

option.name: --color
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1
whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

option.name: --db
option.help:
Connection|array|string (defaults to 'db')
the DB connection object or the application component ID of the DB connection to use when applying migrations. Starting from version 2.0.3, this can also be a configuration array for creating the object.

option.name: --interactive
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
whether to run the command interactively.

option.name: --migrationPath
option.help:
string (defaults to '@app/migrations')
the directory storing the migration classes. This can be either a path alias or a directory.

option.name: --migrationTable
option.help:
string (defaults to '{{%migration}}')
the name of the table for keeping applied migration information.

command.name: migrate/history
command.help:
Displays the migration history.

This command will show the list of migrations that have been applied so far.For example,
yii migrate/history # showing the last 10 migrations
yii migrate/history 5 # showing the last 5 migrations
yii migrate/history all # showing the whole history


- limit: integer (defaults to 10)
the maximum number of migrations to be displayed. If it is 0, the whole migration history will be displayed.

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

option.name: --color
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1
whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

option.name: --db
option.help:
Connection|array|string (defaults to 'db')
the DB connection object or the application component ID of the DB connection to use when applying migrations. Starting from version 2.0.3, this can also be a configuration array for creating the object.

option.name: --interactive
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
whether to run the command interactively.

option.name: --migrationPath
option.help:
string (defaults to '@app/migrations')
the directory storing the migration classes. This can be either a path alias or a directory.

option.name: --migrationTable
option.help:
string (defaults to '{{%migration}}')
the name of the table for keeping applied migration information.

command.name: migrate/mark
command.help:
Modifies the migration history to the specified version. No actual migration will be performed.
yii migrate/mark 101129_185401 # using timestamp
yii migrate/mark m101129_185401_create_user_table # using full name


- version: (required): string
the version at which the migration history should be marked. This can be either the timestamp or the full name of the migration.

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

option.name: --color
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1
whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

option.name: --db
option.help:
Connection|array|string (defaults to 'db')
the DB connection object or the application component ID of the DB connection to use when applying migrations. Starting from version 2.0.3, this can also be a configuration array for creating the object.

option.name: --interactive
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
whether to run the command interactively.

option.name: --migrationPath
option.help:
string (defaults to '@app/migrations')
the directory storing the migration classes. This can be either a path alias or a directory.

option.name: --migrationTable
option.help:
string (defaults to '{{%migration}}')
the name of the table for keeping applied migration information.

command.name: migrate/new
command.help:
Displays the un-applied new migrations.

This command will show the new migrations that have not been applied. For example,
yii migrate/new # showing the first 10 new migrations
yii migrate/new 5 # showing the first 5 new migrations
yii migrate/new all # showing all new migrations


- limit: integer (defaults to 10)
the maximum number of new migrations to be displayed. If it is all, , all available new migrations will be displayed.

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

option.name: --color
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1
whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

option.name: --db
option.help:
Connection|array|string (defaults to 'db')
the DB connection object or the application component ID of the DB connection to use when applying migrations. Starting from version 2.0.3, this can also be a configuration array for creating the object.

option.name: --interactive
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
whether to run the command interactively.

option.name: --migrationPath
option.help:
string (defaults to '@app/migrations')
the directory storing the migration classes. This can be either a path alias or a directory.

option.name: --migrationTable
option.help:
string (defaults to '{{%migration}}')
the name of the table for keeping applied migration information.

command.name: migrate/redo
command.help:
Redoes the last few migrations.

This command will first revert the specified migrations, and then apply them again. For example,
yii migrate/redo # redo the last applied migration
yii migrate/redo 3 # redo the last 3 applied migrations
yii migrate/redo all # redo all migrations


- limit: integer (defaults to 1)
the number of migrations to be redone. Defaults to 1, meaning the last applied migration will be redone.

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

option.name: --color
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1
whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

option.name: --db
option.help:
Connection|array|string (defaults to 'db')
the DB connection object or the application component ID of the DB connection to use when applying migrations. Starting from version 2.0.3, this can also be a configuration array for creating the object.

option.name: --interactive
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
whether to run the command interactively.

option.name: --migrationPath
option.help:
string (defaults to '@app/migrations')
the directory storing the migration classes. This can be either a path alias or a directory.

option.name: --migrationTable
option.help:
string (defaults to '{{%migration}}')
the name of the table for keeping applied migration information.

command.name: migrate/to
command.help:
Upgrades or downgrades till the specified version.

Can also downgrade versions to the certain apply time in the past by providing a UNIX timestamp or a string parseable by the strtotime() function. This means that all the versions applied after the specified certain time would be reverted.
This command will first revert the specified migrations, and then apply them again. For example,
yii migrate/to 101129_185401 # using timestamp
yii migrate/to m101129_185401_create_user_table # using full name
yii migrate/to 1392853618 # using UNIX timestamp
yii migrate/to "2014-02-15 13:00:50" # using strtotime() parseable string

- version: (required): string
either the version name or the certain time value in the past that the application should be migrated to. This can be either the timestamp, the full name of the migration, the UNIX timestamp, or the parseable datetime string.

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

option.name: --color
option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1
whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.

option.name: --db
option.help:
Connection|array|string (defaults to 'db')
the DB connection object or the application component ID of the DB connection to use when applying migrations. Starting from version 2.0.3, this can also be a configuration array for creating the object.

option.help:
boolean, 0 or 1 (defaults to 1)
whether to run the command interactively.

option.name: --migrationPath
option.help:
string (defaults to '@app/migrations')
the directory storing the migration classes. This can be either a path alias or a directory.

option.name: --migrationTable
option.help:
string (defaults to '{{%migration}}')
the name of the table for keeping applied migration information.

command.name: migrate/up
command.help:
Upgrades the application by applying new migrations. For example,
yii migrate # apply all new migrations
yii migrate 3 # apply the first 3 new migrations

- limit: integer (defaults to 0)
the number of new migrations to be applied. If 0, it means applying all available new migrations.

option.name: --appconfig
option.help:
string.
Custom application configuration file path.
If not set, default application configuration is used.

whether to enable ANSI color in the output.
If not set, ANSI color will only be enabled for terminals that support it.
